content.description:
Life in the Countryside

Bene est mihi quia tibi bene est. Habes uxorem tecum, 
habes filium; fruerisfruor, -i (+ abl.): to enjoy mari, fontibusfons, fontis, m.: spring, fountain, agro, villa 
pulcherrima. Ego in villa mea et venorvenor, -ari: to hunt et studeo.
content.question: Which of the following effects does the parallelism in lines 1-2 (Bene...filium) provide?

choices.label: It makes the action more vivid.
It provides a rhythmic quality to the narrative.
It creates a surprising connection between the two ideas.

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
